result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Supervision fees.   Provide DNA sample - pay surcharge.   
Pay all remaining costs and surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge.   Bail to apply.
Any remaining unpaid balance to be paid during the period of Probation.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises defendant that he may not possess a firearm and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT with the victim; no other modifications without the approval of the Court.  
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a 3rd party to arrange time with children.  
The Court ordered that the No Contact Order as to the children no longer exists after today.   
NO illegal drugs.
Defendant to participate in any counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, including any batterers treatment.

Obtain AODA assessment and follow-up treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with random urine screens

Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 36, scheduled for 12-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, assessments & surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges, within 1 year of today's date. Bail on deposit to apply.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment

Huber release privileges for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel Alexis Garcia

defendant.name: Garcia, Miguel Alexis
defendant.address: 5708 West Forest Home Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53220

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Bond Refund Packet
Mailed Bail Refund Notice/Affidavit to Surety.
Count three, per Order signed on 12/2/2015:  The Court grants his request and will allow 14 hours a day release for the days the defendant is working.
Count two, per Order signed on 12/2/2015:  Restitution set at zero.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
No victim was present in court.  The victim has not shown any proof for the restitution she is requesting.  Court ordered restitution set at -0-.
.
Later, same appearances, the defendant is requesting 14 hours a day for release privileges.  The court grants his request and will allow 14 hours a day release for the days the defendant is working.
Hearing concluded.
.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Letters received and filed.

The victim was notified for today's date.
As to count 2:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, with credit for 18 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years. 
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
*   
*   Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment;
*   Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens - no illegal drugs; 
*   No contact with victim.  No other modification without the approval of the court.  
*   Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.  The court ordered that the no contact order as to the children no longer exists after today.
*   Defendant to participate in any other counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, including any batterer's treatment.
*   Obtain/maintain employment; 
*   Pay supervision fees;
*   Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge;
*   Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge,  bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored and he/she may never possess a firearm.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  

As to count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for work and 18 days credit.  Defendant is to report no later than 11/16/2015.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
.
The victim appeared in court after the court had already sentenced the defendant and the parties had left.  She had information as to restitution.
Case adjourned for a restitution hearing in Branch 36.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Received and filed:
Amended information filed charging Ct 1:  Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisc. stat 941.30(2), 939.50(3)(g), 939.63(1)(b); Count 2:  Aggravated Battery (Substantial Risk of Great Bodily Harm), pursuant to Wisc. stat. 940.19(6), 939.50(3)(h);  Ct. 3:  Disorderly Conduct, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestice Abuse Assessments, pursuant to Wisc. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.63(1)(a); Count 4:  Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse, pursuant to Wisc. stats. 941.20(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 968.075(1)(a).
.
As to count 2 as amended, and count 3:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
.
As to counts 1 and 4:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 1 and 4 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Jury trial date of 10/26/15 vacated.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel is requesting an earlier date to allow the defendant to change his plea.
Case calendared for 10/19/2015 at 01:30 p.m. for a plea date.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting another final pretrial date.  Court denied that request but informed the parties that if they resolve it prior to the trial date, they should call the court to get an earlier date.

State's Witness List and State's Motion in LImine.
Defendant's Proposed Witness List and Jury Instructions.
Case remains calendared for 10/26/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for trial.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  State is ready to proceed.

Defense counsel informs the court that they will be proceedin with  "other acts" evidence.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons placed on the record defense counsel requested a status date.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36 for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Bail Hearing. Defense no longer wishes to argue bail. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Scheduling. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Scheduling to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM028238  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/05/2015

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in custody.  Dax Odom for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference and Bail/Bond Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to branch Preliminary Hearing.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sarah R.; Roberto R.; TNR dob 7/24/99; TMR dob 6/25/02; AOG dob 9/7/07 or AJG dob 1/15/12

Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Miguel Alexis Garcia in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. On Courts own motion, Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer stricken from Count 1.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
